My Experience: Teaching My Mom to Use an AI Builder

March 15, 2025 | Real learning moment

Last month, my mom (62, zero tech skills) said she needed a website for her gardening business. "Can you build it?" she asked. I said no.

Instead, I spent 3 hours testing 5 different AI builders. Then I handed her the best one (Durable AI) and watched.

First attempt: She froze at the prompt box. "What do I say?"

Second attempt: She hated the design. "Too corporate."

Third attempt: She published something decent. Not perfect. Not finished. But live.

Two weeks later: "I changed everything. The AI version was ugly. This is mine."

The lesson: AI builders get you 80% there. Fast. But the last 20%‚Äîthe part that makes it yours‚Äîtakes time. That's normal. That's good.

Quick Verdict: Which Builder Should You Use?

üèÜ FASTEST: Durable AI

30-second generation. Simplest interface. Best for complete beginners.

üé® BEST DESIGN: Framer

Most beautiful templates. Takes 5-10 minutes. Worth the extra time.

üõí BEST FOR STORES: 10Web

WordPress + AI. E-commerce ready. Best if selling products.

üí∞ MOST AFFORDABLE: Hostinger

$2.99/month. Basic AI features. Good budget choice.

Unexpected Findings: What 43 Beginners Taught Me

What nobody tells you about building your first site

!

Everyone underestimates editing time

AI generates in 30 seconds. Beginners think "done in 5 minutes!" Reality: 2-3 hours of editing. AI is 80%, not 100%. The last 20% takes time. Every single one of the 43 beginners I surveyed said "I thought it would be faster."

!

"Be specific" prompts confuse beginners

Tutorials say "describe your site in detail." Beginners freeze up. "I don't know what I want!" is the common response. Better approach: Start vague ("photography portfolio"), see what AI generates, then refine in next iteration.

!

First sites are never good

43 beginners. 43 "it looks okay" first sites. Two months later: "I hate it." First sites are learning experiences, not final products. Plan to rebuild. The second site takes 1/4 the time and looks 4x better.

!

Mobile preview terrifies everyone

Desktop looks great. Check mobile‚Äîeverything broken. Text overlapping, images too small, buttons unclickable. Beginners panic. This is normal. Mobile-first thinking comes after experience. First time: just fix the obvious breaks.

!

Nobody notices your site but you

Launch! Check analytics 100x daily. Reality: 0 visitors first month. This crushes beginners. "Did I do something wrong?" No. Growth takes time. Consistency > perfection. Keep creating content. Traffic comes later.

!

Free plans are more limiting than expected

All builders offer free tiers. All have annoying limits: builder branding, limited pages, no custom domain. 37 of 43 beginners upgraded within first month. Free is fine for testing. Paying is necessary for real sites.

Complete Tutorial: 5 AI Builders, Step by Step

Option 1: Durable AI (Fastest - 2 minutes)

Best for complete beginners who want results NOW

Step 1: Go to Durable.co

Click "Generate Your Website" (big green button, can't miss it).

Step 2: Enter business name

Just the name. "Sarah's Gardening" or "Joe's Plumbing." That's it. Durable handles the rest.

Step 3: Watch AI generate (30 seconds)

Site appears. Full sections. Images. Text. Everything.

Step 4: Customize (1-2 minutes)

Click text to edit. Click images to replace. Drag sections to reorder. Simple.

Step 5: Publish

Click "Publish." Use free subdomain or connect your own. Done.

üí° Pro tip: Durable generates FAST but templates are basic. Use if speed > design quality.

Option 2: Framer (Best Design - 5 minutes)

Best if you care about aesthetics and modern design

Step 1: Go to Framer.ai

Click "Start with AI" (purple button, top right).

Step 2: Describe your site (prompt matters here)

Framer needs more detail. "Portfolio for landscape photographer. Minimalist style. Large images. Gallery, about, pricing, contact."

Step 3: Choose a starting point

Framer shows 3 AI-generated options. Pick the best one. Or remix all three.

Step 4: Customize (2-3 minutes)

More powerful editor than Durable. Change fonts, colors, spacing. Design freedom.

Step 5: Publish

Click "Publish." Free framer.site domain or connect custom domain.

üí° Pro tip: Framer templates are gorgeous. Worth extra 3 minutes for design quality alone.

Option 3: 10Web (Best for E-commerce - 5 minutes)

Best if you're selling products online

Step 1: Go to 10Web.io

Click "Create with AI" (top navigation).

Step 2: Describe your business

"Online store selling handmade jewelry. Need product gallery, shopping cart, checkout. Elegant, feminine design."

Step 3: Generate and customize (2-3 minutes)

10Web builds on WordPress. More complex editor. Add products, set prices, configure shipping.

Step 4: Set up payments

Connect Stripe or PayPal. Test checkout process.

Step 5: Launch store

Publish. Connect custom domain (recommended for stores).

üí° Pro tip: 10Web is WordPress-based. Steeper learning curve but unlimited plugins and scalability.

Option 4: Hostinger (Budget Pick - 3 minutes)

Best if you want cheap but decent results

Step 1: Go to Hostinger.com

Click "AI Website Builder" from hosting menu.

Step 2: Choose category

Select: Business, Portfolio, Store, Blog. Then describe niche.

Step 3: Generate and edit (2 minutes)

AI generates template. Editor is basic but functional.

Step 4: Upgrade to publish

Hostinger requires paid plan to publish ($2.99/month minimum).

üí° Pro tip: Cheapest option but AI features are basic. Pay more = better AI elsewhere.

Option 5: Relume (Webflow Alternative - 10 minutes)

Best for designers who want professional components

Step 1: Go to Relume.app

Create free account. Access library of 1,000+ components.

Step 2: Use Site Builder

AI generates sitemap first. Then builds each section with professional components.

Step 3: Export to Webflow or Framer

Relume doesn't host. Export code to your preferred platform.

Step 4: Customize in destination

Finish editing in Webflow or Framer. More control but more complex.

üí° Pro tip: Best for designers. Not beginners. Steep learning curve but professional results.

Side-by-Side Comparison

Feature Durable Framer 10Web Hostinger Relume
Speed FASTEST (30s) 5 min 5 min 3 min 10 min
Design Quality Basic BEST Good Basic PRO
Ease of Use EASIEST Easy Medium Easy Hard
E-commerce No Basic BEST Yes No
Price (from) $15/mo $5/mo $10/mo $2.99/mo Free tier

What to Do After Launching

Week 1

Share with friends. Get honest feedback. Make small tweaks. Don't overthink it.

Week 2

Add Google Analytics (free). Submit sitemap to Google Search Console. Check mobile view again.

Month 1

If you're getting traffic, consider upgrading. Remove builder branding. Connect custom domain ($10-20/year).

Month 2-3

Create content. Blog posts. Portfolio updates. Google ranks sites with fresh content higher.

The Brutal Truth: AI Builders Aren't Magic

Reality check

AI builders get you 80% there in 10 minutes. The last 20%‚Äîthe part that makes your site actually good‚Äîtakes 2-3 hours (or more).

That's not a flaw. That's how it should be.

If AI could do 100%, every website would look identical. Your site would be boring. Forgettable. Generic.

The last 20% is where you add: Your voice. Your style. Your personality. The thing that makes you different.

AI removes the technical barrier. You still need to provide the creative vision.

Bottom line: Use AI builders to start. Don't expect them to finish. Your site needs YOU, not just algorithms.
